pullRequest.title: wappalyzer: Add support for Dom inspection/patterns
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added necessary code.
Added unit tests.
Added CHANGELOG notes.
Used Jsoup as dom selector as Jericho lacks jquery-like selector capabilities.

Fixes zaproxy/zaproxy#6180
Signed-off-by: bettercalln1ck bettercallnck6303@gmail.com

afterCommit.message:
wappalyzer: Add support for Dom inspection

Signed-off-by: nikolai6303 <iit2018152@iiita.ac.in>

nodes.bodyText:
I'm not sure this is going to work properly, I suspect that too many messages will be matched because the assembled property pattern won't match as specifically as the whole DOM selector.
Note I haven't tested IRL, that's just based on reading.
Please restore this to not use a wildcard import.
It would be better to pass in HttpMessage msg, then use msg.getResponseBody().toString().

Could you make the variable names a bit more meaningful here? Ex:

map ➡️ domSelectorMap
link & links ➡️ selectedElement & selectedElements
etc
Can be removed?
Throughout, could you remove the blank lines leading the comments?
If the pattern selector defines both, shouldn't both be required for a match?
Could you make the variable names in here a bit more meaningful as well?
This seems to be unused.

This should be moved up to line 7, under the "Unreleased" heading, as:
### Added
- Support for DOM patterns, aligning with the upstream project (Issue 6180).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,6 +15,7 @@ The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/).
 
 ### Added
 - Added support for CSS patterns, aligning with upstream project.
+- Added support for Dom patterns.

nodes.bodyText: Is this really needed? The WappalyzerPassiveScanner is already using Jericho to parse the contents.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -38,5 +38,7 @@ dependencies {
     implementation("org.apache.xmlgraphics:batik-gvt:$batikVersion")
     implementation("org.apache.xmlgraphics:batik-util:$batikVersion")
 
+    implementation("org.jsoup:jsoup:1.13.1")

nodes.bodyText: I just meant the commented line.
Source is no longer necessary here, right?

nodes.bodyText: dom
Does not seem to be used.
ap and pa is confusing.
Type arguments could be removed.
Type arguments could be removed.
Type arguments could be removed.
This check could be done earlier and return (Collections.emptyList()) to avoid nesting.
The key is already a string.
This could be done in the above if, same logic.
Should start with lower case (same for following if).
Could you add a test for this case?
Could you add a test that does not have the attribute?
Could you add test for this case?

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
  • It does not not show the confidence - this is still todo
  • It allows you to see the 'evidence' used to detect the technologies
  • It does not match technologies on the basis of dom properties as some properties are set by javascript after response is received
  • It does not not show the confidence - this is still todo
  • It does not match technologies on the basis of DOM properties as some properties are set by JavaScript in the browser after response has passed through ZAP
  • It allows you to see the 'evidence' used to detect the technologies
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,7 @@

Technology Detection Using Wappalyzer

  • It does not use the 'Global JavaScript variables' as these are difficult to test without a 'full' browser
  • It does not not show the confidence - this is still todo
  • It allows you to see the 'evidence' used to detect the technologies
    • +
  • It does not match technologies on the basis of dom properties as some properties are set by javascript after response is received

nodes.bodyText: Changed the li ordering and adjusted the text.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,7 @@

Technology Detection Using Wappalyzer

  • It does not use the 'Global JavaScript variables' as these are difficult to test without a 'full' browser
  • It does not not show the confidence - this is still todo
  • It allows you to see the 'evidence' used to detect the technologies
    • +

nodes.bodyText:
Sorry I think I missed this last time: Suggested change
  • It does not match technologies on the basis of DOM properties as some properties are set by JavaScript in the browser after response has passed through ZAP
  • It does not match technologies on the basis of DOM properties as some properties are set by JavaScript in the browser after the response has passed through ZAP
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@

Technology Detection Using Wappalyzer

  • It does not use the 'Global JavaScript variables' as these are difficult to test without a 'full' browser
  • It does not not show the confidence - this is still todo
    • +
  • It does not match technologies on the basis of DOM properties as some properties are set by JavaScript in the browser after response has passed through ZAP
